wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Halfpenny (25 April 1906 – June 1966) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for Great Britain (non-Test matches), and England, and at club level for Widnes, St. Helens and Warrington, as a wing, centre, prop, second-row, or loose forward, i.e. number 2 or 5, 3 or 4, 8 or 10, 11 or 12, or, 13.
